pr_title: [TS] Parallelism is nice and should be respected

timeline.bodyText:
If I understand correctly, this just updates a metric? Can you rename to updateSweepDelayMetric to make sure it is unambiguous?
Also, will this be an expensive metric? Just making sure we're not going back to our old $$$ ways.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: it updates sweep delay only. I didn't include metrics from the beginning to try to avoid costs and that got us into this mess in the first place so not going to worry about it -- we can remove it when we have confidence it works well and it is just a long gauge per strategy
replies.author: gmaretic

timeline.bodyText: nit: as above, rename to sweepDelayMetric
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: ah now I understand, will do 👍
replies.author: gmaretic

timeline.bodyText: nit: overloaded methods should be next to each other
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: they are in the same order as the metrics
replies.author: gmaretic

timeline.message: Do not set metric initially to fix janky tests
Merge branch 'ts/fix-threads' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into ts/fix-threads

timeline.bodyText: This was passing because it was 1 😓
timeline.author: gmaretic
jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: nit: this name is a bit meh, I would normally name this like sweepDelayMetricsUpdater or something. Not too concerned as it's in the SweepDelay class.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
